title: Iterative Learning Control (ILC) Design for Formation Control of Multi-Agent Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational control theory, understanding of linear systems, matrix operation skills
context.additional_context: Theory-practice integrated training for in-service professionals to strengthen job application competencies

learning_goals: It is possible to perform mathematical modeling of formation control problems in multi-agent systems.
It is possible to design the achievement of desired formation patterns within finite time by applying an Iterative Learning Control (ILC) algorithm.
System stability verification is possible through convergence condition analysis based on Linear Matrix Inequalities (LMIs).
It is possible to explain practical controller design methods that account for communication delays and model uncertainties.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
